title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The preceding figure shows the graph of the twice-differentiable function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€³</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, the second derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the x y plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins far above the x axis, far to the left of the y axis, moves steeply downward and to the right, and crosses the x axis at negative 1.33. It reaches a point below the x axis, to the left of the y axis, moves upward and to the right, crosses the origin, and reaches a point above the x axis, to the right of the y axis. It then moves steeply downward and to the right, crossing the x axis at 1.33, and ending far below the x axis, far to the right of the y axis. Note that all values are approximate.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the x y plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins far below the x axis, far to the left of the y axis, moves steeply upward and to the right, and crosses the x axis at negative 1.33. It reaches a point above the x axis, to the left of the y axis, moves downward and to the right, crosses the origin, and reaches a point below the x axis, to the right of the y axis. It then moves steeply upward and to the right, crossing the x axis at 1.33, and ending high above the x axis, far to the right of the y axis. Note that all values are approximate.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the x y plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the x axis at negative 2, moves steeply upward and to the right and reaches a maximum high above the x axis at x equals negative 1.33. It then moves downward and to the right until it reaches the origin. The curve moves back upward and to the right and reaches another maximum high above the x axis at x equals 1.33. It then moves steeply downward and to the right until it ends on the x axis at 2. Note that all values are approximate.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the x y plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the x axis at negative 2, moves steeply downward and to the right and reaches a minimum far below the x axis at x equals negative 1.33. It then moves upward and to the right until it reaches the origin. The curve moves back downward and to the right and reaches another minimum far below the x axis at x equals 1.33. It then moves steeply upward and to the right until it ends on the x axis at 2. Note that all values are approximate.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the x y plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins far above the x axis, far to the left of the y axis, moves steeply downward and to the right, and crosses the x axis at negative 1.33. It reaches a point below the x axis, to the left of the y axis, moves upward and to the right, crosses the origin, and reaches a point above the x axis, to the right of the y axis. It then moves steeply downward and to the right, crossing the x axis at 1.33, and ending far below the x axis, far to the right of the y axis. Note that all values are approximate.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
